page.title: 01N'ERN BOUNDARY OF COTSWOLDS
page.content: An area of Northamptonshire Uplands, with pleasant rolling countryside, large farms and small villages. The area is disected by the A361 road, recently upgraded to form a through route between the Midlands and the south west. Scars still show where the former Great Central Railway passed through this area and Catesby Tunnel is a prominant landmark. The only village in this area is Charwetton. Nearby the RiverCharwell begins its long journey to eventually join the Thames. The village has declined in importance over the years although recently a small estate of executive homes has been built. Nearby lies Church Charwetton with its deserted village. Surrounding the settlement is land used for sheep grazing, although increasingly pasture is being ploughed for wheat, barley and oilseed rape.
